basics.name: Mark McLaughlin
basics.label: UX Design Manager at Google
basics.summary: Design leader with over 20 years background creating end-to-end experiences for web, cloud, mobile, desktop and consumer electronics platforms.

work.name: Google
work.summary: UX design manager for a multinational team of designers and researchers building the next generation of tooling to empower Google's product teams to onboard, deploy, monitor and manage their cloud services.
highlights: Presenting at internal summits demonstrating open-source tooling and extensibility models.
Aligning multiple stakeholders around a common brand identity for the product family.
Defining principles and guidelines for showing health, status and performance of cloud services.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Design director for the multi-disciplinary design teams that create the Visual Studio family of products for millions of developers worldwide; including Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio 2022, Visual Studio for Mac, Azure Lab Services and Azure Notebooks.
highlights: Launch of Visual Studio for Mac 2022 with fully native macOS UI, VoiceOver and Voice Control.
Launch of Visual Studio 2022 for Windows, with IntelliCode support, improved Git integration and themes for neurodiverse users.
Launch of Visual Studio WebView UI Toolkit as an open-source initiative to enable developers to build VSCode extensions using web Components.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: DesignOps lead for the Developer Division at Microsoft; introducing best practices for tooling, design systems and prototyping across over 25 designers working in Redmond and remote locations on Visual Studio, VS Code and Azure developer products.
highlights: Built, managed and deployed documentation and UX guidelines for the Visual Studio family of products.
Co-created and architected Figma plugins to improve design deliverables and accessibility.
Empowered design technologists to commit UI fixes directly to the Visual Studio source codebase.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Managed a team of 8 designers in Raleigh, NC and Redmond, WA, supporting a product organization of over 100 product managers across Azure Boards, Repos and Pipelines (CI/CD) feature sets.
highlights: Introduced briefs, process and design systems to a legacy product team, including adoption of Figma and shared team component libraries.

Piloted usage of Figma across Microsoft, including speaking and sharing best practices at internal events, facilitating over 1,000 users within the Visual Studio, Windows, and Azure product teams to move to one centralised design tool.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Design and prototyping lead for Skype integration on gaming and entertainment products, focusing on Xbox One and casual gaming.
highlights: Lead designer for the UWP (Universal Windows Platform) powered iteration of Skype for Xbox One.
Prototyped deep integration of Skype into the Xbox core platform.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Design and prototyping lead for Skype integration on gaming and entertainment products, focusing on Xbox One and casual gaming.
highlights: Shipped v1.0 of Skype for HoloLens, including a successful deployment to the International Space Station.
Prototyped deep integration of Skype into the Xbox core platform.

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Design lead for Skype and Lync web applications, integrating rich audio, video and text-based communications into Microsoft's consumer and enterprise properties on the web focusing on Office 365, Outlook.com, Dynamics and OneDrive.

work.name: Skype
work.summary: Formed a world-class team of 12 interaction and visual designers defining the Skype and Qik experience across iPhone, iPad, Android, BlackBerry, Symbian, BREW, WebOS, MeeGo and Windows Phone platforms, on all form factors.
highlights: Recognized by Apple in 2013 for Skype on iPad being the most downloaded iPad application of all time.

work.name: Skype
work.summary: Working with carriers, hardware vendors and other partners as a senior designer creating and defining the interaction design and user experience for Skype on mobile including iOS, Meego, Maemo, Java, Android and Symbian platforms. Additional work on consumer electronics, including TV interfaces for Panasonic, LG and Samsung embedded platforms
highlights: Launched first mobile Skype video calling UX on Nokia N900 flagship device
Interaction design for Philips VOIP855 cordless phone, with the highest ARPU of any Skype product

work.name: Skype
work.summary: Application UI design for S60, UIQ, Maemo, Java and Windows Mobile devices.

work.name: Ericsson
work.summary: Interaction designer for operator preload applications on Symbian and Java MIDP devices.
highlights: Creation of use cases, workflows and prototypes to provide a consistent experience across devices
Worked with 3rd party vendors as part of RFQ processes to formalise specifications for app UI
Oversight and direction of vendors to build device prototypes using Flash Lite

work.name: Three
work.summary: Interface design for 3's "My 3" self-care product for early mobile browsers.
highlights: Development of screen flows, storyboard and prototypes
Develop and test new interface XHTML 'widgets' and ensure compatibility across multiple handsets
Designed and created PHP-powered rapid prototyping tools to reduce sign-off and development lifecycle.

work.name: Three
work.summary: Web developer for the first 3G carrier in the United Kingdom.
highlights: Designed and built internal intranet using the Movable Type blogging platform
Designed in-store purchase flows for 1st and 3rd party retailer terminals
Designed web-based 'self-care' portal that helped customers manage their accounts online

Ad-hoc mentoring sessions with early career designers, especially those who were entering the industry from non-traditional career paths and backgrounds.
Contributed early iterations of the club's online presence, including setting up iCal feeds, RSS feeds and their social media identities.

references.name: Rick Rubin, American Recordings
references.reference: It is rare in our business to find someone with the talent to effect such important advances for the industry and its artists while maintaining such integrity and enthusiasm.

references.name: David Powell, Google
references.reference: Mark is a highly capable and very talented individual and I have been fortunate to work with him on projects for both the mobile portal and handsets areas. I have been impressed by the quality of his work, his level of commitment and his pro-active approach.

references.name: John Chang, Gr√∂nska Stadsodling
references.reference: Mark is the man behind the UxD for Skype for iPhone. Back when the iPhone was new to everyone in the world, he somehow immediately "got" the look-and-feel of the platform and managed to create a design that has withstood the test of time. He's one of that rare breed who is not only skilled on the design side but groks the technical side as well.
